name: buildkite
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Buildkite resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`buildkite` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/buildkite/terraform-provider-buildkite).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Buildkite resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/buildkite/terraform-provider-buildkite)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-buildkite` repo](https://github.com/pulumiverse/pulumi-buildkite/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-buildkite` repo](https://github.com/buildkite/terraform-provider-buildkite/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/buildkite/terraform-provider-buildkite)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-buildkite` repo](https://github.com/pulumiverse/pulumi-buildkite/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-buildkite` repo](https://github.com/buildkite/terraform-provider-buildkite/issues).

archivePipelineOnDelete.description: Enable this to archive pipelines when destroying the resource. This is opposed to completely deleting pipelines.

graphqlUrl.description: Base URL for the GraphQL API to use. If not provided, the value is taken from the `BUILDKITE_GRAPHQL_URL` environment variable.

maxRetries.description: Maximum number of retry attempts for retryable HTTP requests. Defaults to 10.

organization.description: The Buildkite organization slug. This can be found on the [settings](https://buildkite.com/organizations/~/settings) page. If not provided, the value is taken from the `BUILDKITE_ORGANIZATION_SLUG` environment variable.

restUrl.description: Base URL for the REST API to use. If not provided, the value is taken from the `BUILDKITE_REST_URL` environment variable.

instanceShape.description:
The instance shape to use for the Hosted Agent cluster queue. This can be a MacOS instance shape or a Linux instance shape.
Valid values are:
- MACOS_ARM64_M4_6X28
- MACOS_ARM64_M4_12X56
- LINUX_AMD64_2X4
- LINUX_AMD64_4X16
- LINUX_AMD64_8X32
- LINUX_AMD64_16X64
- LINUX_ARM64_2X4
- LINUX_ARM64_4X16
- LINUX_ARM64_8X32
- LINUX_ARM64_16X64

agentImageRef.description: A URL reference to a container image that will be used for jobs running within the queue. This URL is required to be publicly available, or pushed to the internal registry available within the cluster. Please note that this value is currently experimental and in preview. Please contact support@buildkite.com to enable this functionality for your organization.

macosVersion.description: Optional selection of a specific macOS version to be selected for jobs in the queue to have available. Please note that this value is currently experimental and may not function as expected.

xcodeVersion.description: Required selection of a specific XCode version to be selected for jobs in the queue to have available. Please note that this value is currently experimental and may not function as expected.

actorEmail.description: The email of the actor (only for users).

actorSlug.description: The slug of the actor (only for teams).

actorType.description: The type of the actor (user or team).

actorUuid.description: The UUID of the actor (user or team).

permissionUuid.description: The UUID of the maintainer permission.

defaultQueue.description: The default queue for the cluster.

description.description: The description of the cluster.

id.description: The GraphQL ID of the cluster.

maintainers.description: List of maintainers (users and teams) for this cluster.

name.description: The name of the cluster.

description.description: The description of the default queue.

id.description: The GraphQL ID of the default queue.

key.description: The key of the default queue.

uuid.description: The UUID of the default queue.

actorEmail.description: The email of the actor (only for users).

actorSlug.description: The slug of the actor (only for teams).

actorType.description: The type of the actor (user or team).

actorUuid.description: The UUID of the actor (user or team).

permissionUuid.description: The UUID of the maintainer permission.

name.description: The name of the user.

email.description: The email address of the organization member.

id.description: The GraphQL ID of the organization member.

name.description: The name of the organization member.

uuid.description: The UUID of the organization member.

name.description: The name of the user.

allowedIpAddresses.description: Space-delimited list of IP addresses (in CIDR notation) allowed to invoke this portal.

createdAt.description: The time when the portal was created.

createdBy.description: Information about the user who created the portal.

description.description: The description of the portal.

name.description: The name of the portal.

query.description: The GraphQL query that the portal executes.

slug.description: The slug of the portal.

userInvokable.description: Whether users can invoke the portal.

name.description: The name of the user.

buildBranches.description: Whether to create builds when branches are pushed.

buildMergeGroupChecksRequested.description: Whether to create merge queue builds for a merge queue enabled GitHub repository with required status checks

buildPullRequestBaseBranchChanged.description: Whether to create builds for pull requests when its base branch changes.

buildPullRequestForks.description: Whether to create builds for pull requests from third-party forks.

buildPullRequestLabelsChanged.description: Whether to create builds for pull requests when labels are added or removed.

buildPullRequestReadyForReview.description: Whether to create a build when a pull request changes to "Ready for review".

buildPullRequests.description: Whether to create builds for commits that are part of a pull request.

buildTags.description: Whether to create builds when tags are pushed.

cancelDeletedBranchBuilds.description: Automatically cancel running builds for a branch if the branch is deleted.

cancelWhenMergeGroupDestroyed.description: Whether to cancel any running builds belonging to a removed merge group.

filterCondition.description: The condition to evaluate when deciding if a build should run. This is only valid when `trigger_mode` is `code`. More details available in [the documentation](https://buildkite.com/docs/pipelines/conditionals).

filterEnabled.description: Whether to filter builds to only run when the condition in `filter_condition` is true.

ignoreDefaultBranchPullRequests.description: Whether to prevent caching pull requests with the source branch matching the default branch.

prefixPullRequestForkBranchNames.description: Prefix branch names for third-party fork builds to ensure they don't trigger branch conditions. For example, the main branch from some-user will become some-user:main.

publishBlockedAsPending.description: The status to use for blocked builds. Pending can be used with [required status checks](https://help.github.com/en/articles/enabling-required-status-checks) to prevent merging pull requests with blocked builds.

publishCommitStatus.description: Whether to update the status of commits in Bitbucket, GitHub, or GitLab.

publishCommitStatusPerStep.description: Whether to create a separate status for each job in a build, allowing you to see the status of each job directly in Bitbucket or GitHub.

pullRequestBranchFilterConfiguration.description: Filter pull requests builds by the branch filter.

separatePullRequestStatuses.description: Whether to create a separate status for pull request builds, allowing you to require a passing pull request build in your [required status checks](https://help.github.com/en/articles/enabling-required-status-checks) in GitHub.

skipBuildsForExistingCommits.description: Whether to skip creating a new build if an existing build for the commit and branch already exists. This option is only valid if the pipeline uses a GitHub repository.

skipPullRequestBuildsForExistingCommits.description: Whether to skip creating a new build for a pull request if an existing build for the commit and branch already exists.

triggerMode.description: What type of event to trigger builds on. Must be one of: - `code` will create builds when code is pushed to GitHub. - `deployment` will create builds when a deployment is created in GitHub. - `fork` will create builds when the GitHub repository is forked. - `none` will not create any builds based on GitHub activity. > `trigger_mode` is only valid if the pipeline uses a GitHub repository. > If not set, the default value is `code` and other provider settings defaults are applied.

useMergeGroupBaseCommitForGitDiffBase.description: When enabled, agents performing a git diff to determine steps to upload based on [`if_changed`](https://buildkite.com/docs/pipelines/configure/step-types/command-step#agent-applied-attributes)comparisons will use the base commit that points to the previous merge group rather than the base branch

defaultMemberRole.description: The default member role for new team members.

description.description: The description of the team.

id.description: The GraphQL ID of the team.

isDefaultTeam.description: Whether this is the default team for the organization.

membersCanCreatePipelines.description: Whether team members can create pipelines.

membersCanCreateRegistries.description: Whether team members can create registries.

membersCanCreateSuites.description: Whether team members can create test suites.

membersCanDestroyPackages.description: Whether team members can destroy packages.

membersCanDestroyRegistries.description: Whether team members can destroy registries.

name.description: The name of the team.

privacy.description: The privacy setting of the team.

slug.description: The slug of the team.

create.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

delete.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Setting a timeout for a Delete operation is only applicable if changes are saved into state before the destroy operation occurs.

read.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Read operations occur during any refresh or planning operation when refresh is enabled.

update.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

create.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

delete.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Setting a timeout for a Delete operation is only applicable if changes are saved into state before the destroy operation occurs.

read.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Read operations occur during any refresh or planning operation when refresh is enabled.

provider.description:
The provider type for the buildkite package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

archivePipelineOnDelete.description: Enable this to archive pipelines when destroying the resource. This is opposed to completely deleting pipelines.

maxRetries.description: Maximum number of retry attempts for retryable HTTP requests. Defaults to 10.

organization.description: The Buildkite organization slug. This can be found on the [settings](https://buildkite.com/organizations/~/settings) page. If not provided, the value is taken from the `BUILDKITE_ORGANIZATION_SLUG` environment variable.

restUrl.description: Base URL for the REST API to use. If not provided, the value is taken from the `BUILDKITE_REST_URL` environment variable.

This is a description for the registry, this may describe the usage for it, the region, or something else
which would help identify the registry's purpose.

ecosystem.description: The ecosystem of the registry. **Warning:** This value cannot be changed after creation. Any attempts to update this field will result in API errors.

buildkite:Pipeline/pipeline:Pipeline.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage pipelines for repositories.

More information on pipelines can be found in the [documentation](https://buildkite.com/docs/pipelines).

> **Note:** When creating a new pipeline, the Buildkite API requires at least one team to be associated with it. You must use the 'default_team_id' attribute to specify this initial team. The 'buildkite_pipeline_team' resource can then be used to manage team access for existing pipelines.

## Import

Using `pulumi import`, import resources using the `id`. For example:

import a pipeline resource using the pipelines GraphQL ID

GraphQL ID for a pipeline can be found on its settings page

```sh
$ pulumi import buildkite:Pipeline/pipeline:Pipeline pipeline UGlwZWxpbmUtLS00MzVjYWQ1OC1lODFkLTQ1YWYtODYzNy1iMWNmODA3MDIzOGQ=
```

allowRebuilds.description: Whether rebuilds are allowed for this pipeline.

badgeUrl.description: The badge URL showing build state.

branchConfiguration.description: Configure the pipeline to only build on this branch conditional.

cancelIntermediateBuilds.description: Whether to cancel builds when a new commit is pushed to a matching branch.

cancelIntermediateBuildsBranchFilter.description: Filter the `cancel_intermediate_builds` setting based on this branch condition.

clusterId.description: Attach this pipeline to the given cluster GraphQL ID.

clusterName.description: The name of the cluster the pipeline is (optionally) attached to.

color.description: A color hex code to represent this pipeline.

defaultTeamId.description: The GraphQL ID of a team to initially assign to the pipeline. This is required by the Buildkite API when creating a new pipeline. The team assigned here will be given 'Manage Build and Read' access. Further team associations can be managed with the `buildkite.Pipeline.Team` resource after the pipeline is created.

defaultTimeoutInMinutes.description: Set pipeline wide timeout for command steps.

description.description: Description for the pipeline. Can include emoji ðŸ™Œ.

emoji.description: An emoji that represents this pipeline.

maximumTimeoutInMinutes.description: Set pipeline wide maximum timeout for command steps.

name.description: Name to give the pipeline.

pipelineTemplateId.description: The GraphQL ID of the pipeline template applied to this pipeline.

providerSettings.description: Control settings depending on the VCS provider used in `repository`.

repository.description: URL to the repository this pipeline is configured for.

skipIntermediateBuilds.description: Whether to skip queued builds if a new commit is pushed to a matching branch.

skipIntermediateBuildsBranchFilter.description: Filter the `skip_intermediate_builds` setting based on this branch condition.

slug.description: A custom identifier for the pipeline. If provided, this slug will be used as the pipeline's URL path instead of automatically converting the pipeline name. If not provided, the slug will be [derived](https://buildkite.com/docs/apis/graphql/cookbooks/pipelines#create-a-pipeline-deriving-a-pipeline-slug-from-the-pipelines-name) from the pipeline `name`.

steps.description: The YAML steps to configure for the pipeline. Can also accept the `steps` attribute from the [`buildkite.Pipeline.getSignedSteps`](https://www.terraform.io/docs/data-sources/signed_pipeline_steps) data source to enable a signed pipeline. Defaults to `buildkite-agent pipeline upload`.

webhookUrl.description: The webhook URL used to trigger builds from VCS providers.

buildkite:Organization/getRegistry:getRe.description:
Use this data source to retrieve information about a Buildkite Package Registry.

A package registry is a private repository for your organization's packages.
See https://buildkite.com/docs/packages for more information.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getRegistry.

slug.description: The slug of the registry. This is used to identify the registry.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getRegistry.

color.description: A color representation of the registry.

description.description: A description for the registry.

emoji.description: An emoji to use with the registry.

id.description: The GraphQL ID of the registry.

name.description: The name of the registry.

slug.description: The slug of the registry. This is used to identify the registry.

teamIds.description: A list of team GraphQL IDs that have access to this registry.

buildkite:Pipeline/getSignedSteps:getSig.description: Use this data source to sign pipeline steps with a JWKS key. You will need to have the corresponding verification key present on the agents that run this the steps in this pipeline. You can then use these steps in a `buildkite.Pipeline.Pipeline` resource. See [RFC 7517](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7517) for more information about the JWKS format. See the Buildkite [documentation](https://buildkite.com/docs/agent/v3/signed_pipelines) for more info about signed pipelines. Note that the PS512 and ES512 signature algorithms are nondeterministic and will result in the signature changing on each run. Use EdDSA to avoid drift.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getSignedSteps.

jwks.description: The JSON Web Key Set (JWKS) to use for signing. All double-quotes in the JSON object must be escaped `\"`. If `jwks_key_id` is not specified, and the set contains exactly one key, that key will be used.

repository.description: The repository that will be checked out in a build of the pipeline.

unsignedSteps.description: The steps to sign in YAML format.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getSignedSteps.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

jwks.description: The JSON Web Key Set (JWKS) to use for signing. All double-quotes in the JSON object must be escaped `\"`. If `jwks_key_id` is not specified, and the set contains exactly one key, that key will be used.

repository.description: The repository that will be checked out in a build of the pipeline.

unsignedSteps.description: The steps to sign in YAML format.

pulumi:providers:buildkite/terraformConf.description: This function returns a Terraform config object with terraform-namecased keys,to be used with the Terraform Module Provider.
